intro: Acinodendron glabratum, commonly known as the smooth acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature.
